title: FPS Dropped from 300 to average 130
body:
So this isn't a new issue for me, but one I'm so stumped at understanding why it's an issue.

I got this computer over a year ago, and when I played LoL on it, I had 250-300 FPS on max quality settings throughout the whole game.

However for several months I noticed a dip in FPS, where the game would spawn with 300, but then rapidly drop to 200 by the time minions spawn. Now I played around with some settings atempting to fix (basically just optimized via GeForce Experience) and I'm at 135 usually consistently. 

I'm not quite sure why in the first place I got such a huge dip in FPS, is it LoL that dipped or is it my computer?

Specs: 
Intel(R) Core i5-6500 CPU @ 3.20GHz 3.19 GHz
16.0 GB (RAM)
64-bit Operating System
Windows 10
1920 x 1080, 60Hz Monitor
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 950

Any ideas for why or how to fix?

replies.body: Quick question which might solve all of this without too many troubles, are you using NVidia's G-Sync at the same time as League's V-Sync option in-game? If so, turn off g-sync and only use v-sync and test that out for me. If that doesn't help we can dig a little further!

Hmm, I opened up my NVidia Control Panel and there doesn't seem to be a g-sync at all. 

https://i.imgur.com/9anCBnC.jpg

However, one thing I noticed was for some reason the FPS was set to be capped at 144, uncapped it, and now it's hovering in the 160-180 range (with the game starting at 200-220 by the time minions spawn). This probably explains why it dropped to 135 and its likely the setting that got changed when I tried optimizing it via GeForce Experience. So, hey that's a step forward!

I looked and V-sync was disabled, however when I enabled it, my FPS immediately locked at 60 and didn't move.

EDIT: Also just because I found out: Monitor is NOC (Model: M2060SW) 1920 x 1080 16:9 Aspect, in case that info was needed.
Same here. I went from 250fps to barely hitting 40fps. Overwatch and pubg get around 100+fps. Whats the problem riot? =C
